newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft sees charge from WebTV deal.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft sees charge from WebTV deal.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said Sunday it expects to take a charge of about 50 percent to 60 percent of the value of its $425 million acquisition of privately held WebTV Networks Inc.
The company said it had not yet finalized exactly what size charge it would take but said that it expected it to be 50 percent to 60 percent of the deal.

The charge will be taken in the quarter that the deal closes which will be either Microsoft's fourth fiscal quarter of 1997 or the first fiscal quarter of 1998, depending on regulatory approval. Microsoft said the rest of the goodwill for WebTV will be written-off shortly after that.
Microsoft said the $425 million comprised mainly of Microsoft shares given to the management of WebTV and its employees but declined to specify how much of the acquisition price was cash.
